intro: Jussiaea pedunculata, commonly known as the slender water willow, is a herbaceous plant native to wetland environments in South America. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often found in marshes and along the edges of streams. The plant features slender, branching stems with small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers, and are clustered in terminal spikes. Jussiaea pedunculata plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
